body.p: His Excellency Governor Beriah Magoffin Governor of the Commonwealth of Kentucky

We the undersigned would humbly lay before you, that at the Decr Term of the Lyon Circuit Court in the year 1860 judgment was rendered against G. W. Lady for Sixty Dollars on indictment for keeping tipling house that said Geo. W. Lady is a very poor man with a large & helpless family his children are all girls & his wife a criple, he is bearly able to provide them with the necessaries of life using his utmost energies We would also state that his health is bad, besides he is badly & think & know if a capias is issued he would not be able to liquidate the debt & consequently would have to lay in jail until the law was satisfied, which no doubt would prove ^a^ great detriment to his health, besides a great discomfiture to his breadless family since the pardoning power alone rests in the Executive. We pray that his Excellency remit the fine thus assessed
Eddyville Ky
May 22nd 1862
